page.syntax: C UI_GET_TEXT(C title,C prompt[,C default_choice[,C format_string]])

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: prompt
argument.description: The descriptive text next to the text field.

argument.name: default_choice
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". A default value to display in the text field.

argument.name: format_string
argument.description: Optional. Default = "" (all characters). Forces the entered text to follow a specific format. The format string is a sequence of special characters that dictates how you are to enter a valid text string.

item.name: N
item.description: Any upper letter, digit, sign or decimal

item.name: n
item.description: Any letter, digit, sign or decimal

page.discussion: UI_GET_TEXT() creates and displays a dialog box containing a text field. The text that you enter or change is returned as a Result_String. This function is useful for obtaining a text string that conforms to a specified format.

section.description: The Result_String will be empty ("") if the Cancel button is selected.

section.title: Example
section.description: The dialog box presents a default choice of "Green" then prompts the user for a favorite color.
section.example: dim color as C color = "" color = ui_get_text("Favorite color","Enter your favorite color ", "Green", "&&&&&&&&&&&") ? color = "Purple"

section.description: This example implements a "find by key" function using UI_GET_TEXT().
section.example: dim key as C key = ui_get_text("Find", "Find what") if (key <> "") then topparent.find(key) end if
